business.headline: Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

entertainment.headline: Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali laid to rest in LahoreThe late Pakistani model and actor Humaira Asghar Ali was laid to rest in Pakistan's Lahore on Friday. Her funeral was attended by a small gathering of people.

Love Island USA Season 7 Finale: All about when and where to watch and the finalistsAs 'Love Island USA Season 7' nears its end, four couples remain in the running for the $100,000 prize. The finale promises a dramatic conclusion as viewers await to see which couple will emerge victorious.

Actor Kushal Tandon appeals for privacy after fan intrudes his homeActor Kushal Tandon said his home was trespassed on by a fan while he was away. He expressed concern about privacy, especially since his family lives with him. The actor also urged fans to maintain mutual respect and understanding.

Kareena's car was attacked after Saif Ali Khan's stabbing incident: Ronit RoyActor Ronit Roy shared that actor Kareena Kapoor's car was attacked after her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan's hospital discharge. The actor, who manages a security agency, said this further prompted enhanced security measures.

Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya: Tiger Shroff elated over Superman x Baaghi crossoverActor Tiger Shroff expressed excitement over a reference to his film 'Baaghi' in the new 'Superman' movie. The Hindi dubbed version of the film gave a shout-out to 'Baaghi' and used the dialogue 'Chhoti Bachi Ho Kya?'.

Bella Thorne claims Charlie Puth vilified her after she refused to sleep with himAmerican actor Bella Thorne has accused singer Charlie Puth of spreading false claims about their brief relationship, following a series of social media exchanges. Both have since clarified their positions and moved on, with Thorne engaged and Puth married.

TWICE drops empowering, high-energy music video for This is ForK-pop sensation TWICE has made a powerful comeback with their fourth album 'This is For', celebrating womanhood through bold beats and confident visuals. The group's new music video and world tour mark a mature shift in their style, inspiring fans across the globe with themes of self-love and empowerment.

Shiva Rajkumar's look from Ram Charan's Peddi unveiled on his birthdayThe makers of the Telugu film 'Peddi' have unveiled Kannada star Shiva Rajkumar's character name as GourNaidu on his birthday. The film is set for a global release on March 27, 2026.

Censor Board faces flak for cuts in Superman and F1, fans say grow upThe Censor Board has faced widespread criticism for cutting a romantic scene from the Hollywood film 'Superman', sparking debates on its inconsistent censorship standards compared to Bollywood movies. This controversy highlighted ongoing tensions over cultural sensitivity and film certification practices in India.

Are Ashish Chanchlani and Elli AvrRam dating? Fans think so after latest postAshish Chanchlani and Elli AvRam shared a cryptic Instagram post on Saturday, fuelling dating rumours amongst fans. The caption "Finally," added fuel to the already surfacing rumours.

Mini Mathur says many use what Shefali Jariwala did, stresses doctor's adviceFollowing the death of Shefali Jariwala, Mini Mathur emphasised the urgent need for medical supervision and open dialogue to ensure health and safety in beauty procedures.

Panchayat's Sunita Rajwar says people are abusing her over a scene in Season 4Actor Sunita Rajwar responded to backlash from a scene in Panchayat Season 4 in a recent interview. The scene involves Rajwar's character, Kranti Devi, making objectionable remarks towards a pregnant character.

Our new travel buddy: Patralekhaa wants to go bungee jumping with Rajkummar, babyActor Patralekhaa expressed her desire to visit New Zealand with her husband, actor Rajkummar Rao, and their future baby - and even try bungee jumping together. In a recent interview, she also spoke about taking a break from work to focus on her pregnancy.

Exclusive: Salman Khan pushed me to explore commercial roles, says Chitrangada SinghChitrangda Singh joined Salman Khan's upcoming film, 'Galwan', marking her commercial film debut with him. She told India Today he encouraged her to explore mainstream cinema.

Varun Dhawan gifts his sunglasses to young fan at airport, wins hearts. WatchIn a heartwarming gesture, actor Varun Dhawan gifted his sunglasses to a young fan at Mumbai airport on Friday. The actor recently wrapped up the Pune schedule of his upcoming film 'Border 2'.

Maalik vs Aankhon… box office Day 1: Rajkummar's film outshines Shanaya's debutRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' opened with a modest Rs 3.35 crore on Day 1 amidst tough competition. Meanwhile, Shanaya Kapoor's debut 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' witnessed a slow start.

Anupam Kher hosts special screening of Tanvi The Great for President MurmuThe President of India, Droupadi Murmu, watched the eagerly awaited film 'Tanvi The Great' at a special screening in Rashtrapati Bhavan. Featuring a stellar cast, it releases on July 18.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

general news.headline: Woman alleges rape, father claims accident: Twists and turns in IIM-Calcutta caseA woman alleged that she was raped by an MBA student inside the boys' hostel of IIM-Calcutta. Her father, however, said she fell from an auto-rickshaw.

Don't jump to conclusions based on pilots' conversation: Centre on crash reportThe initial probe has revealed that three seconds after take-off from Ahmedabad, fuel supply to both engines of the Air India Boeing 787 got cut off.

Final LIVE: Iga Swiatek takes early break in 1st set vs Amanda AnisimovaWimbledon 2025 women's singles final Live Updates: Iga Swiatek is looking for her maiden title at the All England Club while Amanda Anisimova will be aiming to claim her first Grand Slam title on Saturday.

3rd Test Day 3 Live: Nitish falls early after teaIND vs ENG, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: Nitish Kumar Reddy's stay at the crease has come to an end as Ben Stokes gets the breakthrough for England. All eyes will now be on Ravindra Jadeja as he is joined by Washington Sundar in the middle.

Air India crash: The many scenarios that fuel cut-off throws upThe AAIB's July 11, 2025, report on the June 12 Air India Boeing 787-8 crash in Ahmedabad, killing 260, cites fuel control switches moving to 'Cutoff' post-takeoff. Pilot confusion, mechanical issues, or sabotage are under investigation, with a final report due by June 2026.

Presumes guilt: Pilots' union claims crash report biased, questions 'secrecy'The pilots' association expressed surprise at the 'secrecy' surrounding the investigation into the June 12 Air India crash and questioned the qualifications of the investigators.
Trump announces 30% tariff on goods imported from Mexico, EU from August 1US President Donald Trump announced a 30% tariff on goods imported from Mexico and European Union from August 1.

Project, kajal, deedar: Chhangur Baba's codewords for conversion revealedThe investigation in the Chhangur Baba case revealed the self-styled godman's codewords. In this secret lingo, "project" referred to the targeted girls and "kajal karna" implied mentally influencing or manipulating someone.

What is the formula for bringing middle-class audience back to theatres?The Indian middle-class audience has long been the driving force behind theatrical success, but the shifting focus towards niche, urban content has left them disconnected. To bring them back to cinemas, filmmakers must offer relatable stories, strong characters, and value-for-money entertainment that reflects their everyday lives.

Amit Shah gives 'Viksit Keralam' call, blasts Pinarayi Vijayan over corruptionSetting the stage for the local body polls later this year and the Assembly election in 2026, Amit Shah emphasised that only the NDA could bring development to Kerala.

'I didn't cut off fuel': Cockpit exchange of Air India pilots before crashAs per the report, one of the pilots aboard the ill-fated Air India Boeing 787 that crashed in Ahmedabad on June 12 asked, "Why did you cutoff the fuel?" The other pilot responded, "I did not do so."

Neeraj Chopra-Arshad Nadeem face off set for 1st time after Olympics 2024Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem are all set to renew their rivalry on the field as the India and Pakistan stars will face off at the Silselia Diamond League in Poland, which will take place on August 16.

Why Bengaluru's chicken-rice for stray dogs is a bone of contentionBengaluru's civic body, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), plans to serve chicken-rice to 5,000 street dogs every day at an annual cost of Rs 2.88 crore. The plan is aimed at curbing the aggression of dogs. Supporters call it humane, while critics slam it as a misuse of taxpayer money. Here's the debate.

7 years ago, US body flagged potential fuel control switch issue on 737 jetsAir India crash probe: Since the bulletin by the FAA was advisory and not mandatory, Air India did not perform the recommended inspections.

Sinner rules out elbow injury concerns, ready for Wimbledon final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner has ruled out injury concerns with regards to his elbow and is raring to go against Carlos Alcaraz in the Wimbledon 2025 final for the men's singles division.

KL Rahul becomes 2nd Indian batter with multiple Test hundreds at Lord'sKL Rahul became the second India batter to have scored multiple Test hundreds at Lord's. Rahul achieved the feat on Day 3 of the third test against  England.

Floating hotels, silk trails and jungle safaris: India's cruise storyCruises - both domestic and international - are emerging as the next big travel trend in India. A new travel trend report by SOTC and Thomas Cook notes that Indians are increasingly opting for new and unique travel formats, with cruises topping the list.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

DK Shivakumar's cryptic 'fighting for chair' remark amid tussle with SiddaramaiahDeputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's comments about holding on to chairs drew laughter from the audience. However, the veiled remark—coming amid an ongoing power tussle with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah—has sparked fresh speculation over the future of Karnataka's leadership.

Screening doesn't end at approval: US to deport visa holders who break rulesThe US embassy in India has issued a strict warning to visa holders about compliance with American laws. Failure to follow rules may lead to visa revocation and deportation as the Trump administration tightens immigration policies.

Censor Board faces flak for cuts in Superman and F1, fans say grow upThe Censor Board has faced widespread criticism for cutting a romantic scene from the Hollywood film 'Superman', sparking debates on its inconsistent censorship standards compared to Bollywood movies. This controversy highlighted ongoing tensions over cultural sensitivity and film certification practices in India.

Concern for India as debt diplomacy sees Bangladesh, Pakistan converge with ChinaWith its debt diplomacy, China has turned Pakistan into its vassal state. Now, it is trying the same in Bangladesh, whose economy is in tatters. This has resulted in the convergence of the interests of Beijing with those of Islamabad and Dhaka in India's backyard, a concern which was recently flagged by CDS General Anil Chauhan.

Hunted down, raped by sex cult in the woods: Woman's lawsuit against cop fatherCourtney Tamagny has filed a lawsuit accusing her father, the Leornia Police Chief, of ritualistic abuse spanning over a decade. She alleged that he is part of a satanic cult that held horrific ceremonies in the woods near their home.

Kareena's car was attacked after Saif Ali Khan's stabbing incident: Ronit RoyActor Ronit Roy shared that actor Kareena Kapoor's car was attacked after her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan's hospital discharge. The actor, who manages a security agency, said this further prompted enhanced security measures.

Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali laid to rest in LahoreThe late Pakistani model and actor Humaira Asghar Ali was laid to rest in Pakistan's Lahore on Friday. Her funeral was attended by a small gathering of people.

The actor, who manages a security agency, said this further prompted enhanced security measures.

sports.headline: Where does Virat Kohli rank among fab four? Kane Williamson revealsNew Zealand's batting stalwart Kane Williamson recently revealed where he ranks India's Virat Kohli among the fab four. Kohli recentlu announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the ongoing England tour.

Neeraj Chopra-Arshad Nadeem face off set for 1st time after Olympics 2024Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem are all set to renew their rivalry on the field as the India and Pakistan stars will face off at the Silselia Diamond League in Poland, which will take place on August 16.

Final LIVE: Iga Swiatek vs Amanda Anisimova underway on Centre CourtWimbledon 2025 women's singles final Live Updates: Iga Swiatek is looking for her maiden title at the All England Club while Amanda Anisimova will be aiming to claim her first Grand Slam title on Saturday.

Mitchell Starc eyes special milestone in landmark 100th Test for AustraliaWI vs AUS: Mitchell Starc, playing in his 100th Test, has a chance to reach the landmark of 400 Test wickets. After winning the series 2-0, Australia will be looking for a clean-sweep in Jamaica.

After 650 days away with injury, Murali Sreeshankar returns with 8.05 m jump in PuneIndia's long jump sensation Murali Sreeshankar made a sensational return to the track as he registered an 8.05m jump in Pune during the Indian Open Athletics Championships on Saturday, July 12.

KL Rahul becomes 2nd Indian batter with multiple Test hundreds at Lord'sKL Rahul became the second India batter to have scored multiple Test hundreds at Lord's. Rahul achieved the feat on Day 3 of the third test against  England.

WWE Evolution: Full matchcard, livestreaming details and all you need to knowThe WWE Evolution 2025 is all set to emanate from the State Farm Arena in Atlanta, Georgia on Sunday, July 13. This is the second time the all-women Premium Live Event will take place in WWE history.

Gavaskar fumes at 'bodyline' tactic against injured Rishabh PantSunil Gavaskar criticised England's aggressive short ball tactics on injured Rishabh Pant during Day 3 in Lord's. He called the approach unsportsmanlike and urged the ICC to enforce stricter fielding rules.

Rishabh Pant equals MS Dhoni's historic record with fifty in Lord's TestENG vs IND: Rishabh Pant equalled MS Dhoni's record for most fifty-plus scores by a visiting wicketkeeper-batter on English soil. Pant reached the landmark on Day 3 of the Lord's Test.

Lord's Test: Ravi Shastri slams time-wasting by umpires on Day 3 with ball changeRavi Shastri has slammed the umpires for time-wasting as they went for a ball change right after the drinks break. The Lord's Test has already been marred by a slow over-rate.

Cummins hints at missing South Africa series to prepare for Ashes 2025Pat Cummins has hinted that he could miss the upcoming white-ball series against South Africa at home to prepare himself for the Ashes series set to take place later this year.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
